scenario_text.value: All right, time for us to go, Jijimon.

Yes... Allow me to express my gratitude once
again. Thank you for protecting this place.
Heheh, don’t mention it!
I’m so happy everyone’s safe...
Yeah... *sniff* It’s so great...

Miu’s had the waterworks going for a while.
Hehe, I can hardly blame her.

She was so worried... We should let her cry
it all out.

Hehe, lookit that snot-covered face. Yer
messing up them pretty looks, y’know?

Hey, leave her alone, man. Now’s not the time
for jokes.

Miu deserves a moment, sure, but the rest of
us can’t take a break.

Right. You mean what Baihumon and that boy
mentioned... The Four Holy Beasts?

Yeah... Head for the shrines to the north,
south and east, they said.

And you’re not sure where these shrines might
be, right, Jijimon?
Yep. Sorry I can’t be more helpful than that.
Which way should we go, then?
Hmm, good question.

We should head north first, right? Something
about the barrier up there?

Moving in the order of the weakening barriers
makes sense. But is that really enough?
What do you mean?

If the Master’s Kenzoku are on the move, then
they must know about the barriers too.

If so, the enemy should be gathered at the
weakest barrier. It’s gonna be a tough fight.

Wouldn’t it be safer to start from a place
with fewer enemies?

Hrmm, catch them unaware, then? A logical
proposal, I’d say.
No, maybe not.

Without knowing how the enemies are moving,
tons of them may be waiting for us anywhere.

In that case, we have to find the Four
Holy Beasts first.

Wouldn’t moving in the order of weakening
barriers be the easiest course of action?

She’s right. If we don’t hurry they might get
the jump on us!

If we’re in such a rush, why’re we wasting
time blabbing around here?

We got a fight waiting for us no matter where
we go. Why care about the enemy’s approach?

Dang, Ryo, you’re chomping at the bit for
a fight, aren’t you?
Shaddup, that’s not it.

I’m scared of fighting, but if we gotta do it
then I just think talk is cheap, that’s all.

Ho ho, Ryo speaks truly, but we mustn’t allow
ourselves to panic.

We met Baihumon by pure happenstance. There’s
no telling what may occur. We must take care.

So we have to think hard before taking the
next step...
(Man, everyone’s changed so much.)

(Shuuji seems as serious as ever, but he’s
looking ahead with all our safety in mind.)

(Aoi’s saying exactly what she feels, pulling
everyone together.)

(Ryo seems pretty proactive here. Still seems
like he might leap before he looks, though.)
(The one who grew the most is...)
Shuuji.
Aoi.
Ryo.

You’ve gotten such a positive outlook these
days, Shuuji. I agree with your thinking.

Positive? I’m just trying to think of a way
to keep everyone safe, same as always...

If anything, I’m still as pessimistic as
I ever was.

Nonsense! Thinking of your friends’ safety is
hardly something to criticize.
Yeah! You said a good thing, Shuuji!

Even with your mission, life takes priority.
Your way of thinking is not to be disavowed.
Ah, um, thank you, sir.

Ha ha... I can’t remember the last time
someone’s praised me to my face...

You’ve gotten strong, Aoi. You can say how
you’re feeling like it’s nothing now.
Oh... Did I come off as conceited?
No, no no! Not in the least!

I was just impressed, is all. You’ve really
become a leader for us.
You’re so cool, Aoi!
Is that so...? *whew* That’s a relief.

You’re right, of course. People change in
such high-stake situations.

Sit on the fence for too long, and we’ll die
here without accomplishing anything.

I hate that idea, so I’ve been pushing myself
to get stronger⁠—or at least act the part.
Aoi...
Just don’t push yourself, okay, Aoi?

I won’t, honest. I know I’m not the only one
doing their best here.

Ho ho ho, a strong child, indeed. Positively
extraordinary.

You’ve grown too, Ryo. You would’ve been
shaking in your boots before.

Say what? Thanks for the backhanded
compliment, jerk.

I mean, it’s not like you’re wrong. I was
practically pissing my pants for a while.

Ah, sorry. I didn’t mean to make fun of you.
I’m just happy you’ve gotten so gung ho.

Yeah, yeah, I got you. I ain’t mad or
nothing.

Besides, freezing up won’t help anything. We
gotta move in some kinda direction.

Oh, I mean, don’t get me wrong! I ain’t
saying I’m freaked out over here!

Yeah, I hear you. You’ve gotten pretty
dependable, you know.

Hey. Don’t go tossing out compliments like
candy, creepshow...

Indeed, standing up to the enemy, knowing
full well the threat they hold to us...

That is no mean feat, child. You are
a splendid individual.
Shaddup, already...

All of you are strong, indeed. I believe you
can stand against the Master.

The road ahead is fraught with dangers, but
I do not doubt you will overcome them.

Thank you. We’ll make sure we stop the
Master, come what may.

Yes. And to do that, we should think about
where to go next together.
